00001 /* $Id: scanner.ll 39 2008-08-03 10:07:15Z tb $ -*- mode: c++ -*- */
00004 %{ /*** C/C++ Declarations ***/
00005 
00006 #include <string>
00007 
00008 #include "scanner.h"
00009 
00010 /* import the parser's token type into a local typedef */
00011 typedef example::Parser::token token;
00012 typedef example::Parser::token_type token_type;
00013 
00014 /* Work around an incompatibility in flex (at least versions 2.5.31 through
00015  * 2.5.33): it generates code that does not conform to C89.  See Debian bug
00016  * 333231 <http://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=333231>.  */
00017 #undef yywrap
00018 #define yywrap()        1
00019 
00020 /* By default yylex returns int, we use token_type. Unfortunately yyterminate
00021  * by default returns 0, which is not of token_type. */
00022 #define yyterminate() return token::END
00023 
00024 /* This disables inclusion of unistd.h, which is not available under Visual C++
00025  * on Win32. The C++ scanner uses STL streams instead. */
00026 #define YY_NO_UNISTD_H
00027 
00028 %}
00029 
00030 /*** Flex Declarations and Options ***/
00031 
00032 /* enable c++ scanner class generation */
00033 %option c++
00034 
00035 /* change the name of the scanner class. results in "ExampleFlexLexer" */
00036 %option prefix="Example"
00037 
00038 /* the manual says "somewhat more optimized" */
00039 %option batch
00040 
00041 /* enable scanner to generate debug output. disable this for release
00042  * versions. */
00043 %option debug
00044 
00045 /* no support for include files is planned */
00046 %option noyywrap nounput 
00047 
00048 /* enables the use of start condition stacks */
00049 %option stack
00050 
00051 /* The following paragraph suffices to track locations accurately. Each time
00052  * yylex is invoked, the begin position is moved onto the end position. */
00053 %{
00054 #define YY_USER_ACTION  yylloc->columns(yyleng);
00055 %}
00056 
00057 %% /*** Regular Expressions Part ***/
00058 
00059  /* code to place at the beginning of yylex() */
00060 %{
00061     // reset location
00062     yylloc->step();
00063 %}
00064 
00065  /*** BEGIN EXAMPLE - Change the example lexer rules below ***/
00066 
00067 [0-9]+ {
00068     yylval->integerVal = atoi(yytext);
00069     return token::INTEGER;
00070 }
00071 
00072 [0-9]+"."[0-9]* {
00073     yylval->doubleVal = atof(yytext);
00074     return token::DOUBLE;
00075 }
00076 
00077 [A-Za-z][A-Za-z0-9_,.-]* {
00078     yylval->stringVal = new std::string(yytext, yyleng);
00079     return token::STRING;
00080 }
00081 
00082  /* gobble up white-spaces */
00083 [ \t\r]+ {
00084     yylloc->step();
00085 }
00086 
00087  /* gobble up end-of-lines */
00088 \n {
00089     yylloc->lines(yyleng); yylloc->step();
00090     return token::EOL;
00091 }
00092 
00093  /* pass all other characters up to bison */
00094 . {
00095     return static_cast<token_type>(*yytext);
00096 }
00097 
00098  /*** END EXAMPLE - Change the example lexer rules above ***/
00099 
00100 %% /*** Additional Code ***/
00101

00121 /* This implementation of ExampleFlexLexer::yylex() is required to fill the
00122  * vtable of the class ExampleFlexLexer. We define the scanner's main yylex
00123  * function via YY_DECL to reside in the Scanner class instead. */

00126 #undef yylex
